sn12.34:4.2: “Mendicants, I will teach seventy-seven grounds for knowledge.
sn12.34:4.3: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
sn12.34:5.1: “And what are the seventy-seven grounds for knowledge?
sn12.34:5.2: The knowledge that rebirth is a condition for old age and death,
sn12.34:5.3: and the knowledge that when rebirth doesn’t exist, there is no old age and death.
sn12.34:5.4: Also regarding the past: the knowledge that rebirth is a condition for old age and death, and the knowledge that when rebirth doesn’t exist, there is no old age and death.
sn12.34:5.5: Also regarding the future: the knowledge that rebirth is a condition for old age and death, and the knowledge that when rebirth doesn’t exist, there is no old age and death.
sn12.34:5.6: And the knowledge that this knowledge of the stability of natural principles is liable to end, vanish, fade away, and cease.
sn12.34:6.1: The knowledge that future existence is a condition for rebirth …
sn12.34:6.10: The knowledge that ignorance is a condition for choices, and the knowledge that when ignorance doesn’t exist, there are no choices.
sn12.34:6.11: Also regarding the past: the knowledge that ignorance is a condition for choices, and the knowledge that when ignorance doesn’t exist, there are no choices.
sn12.34:6.12: Also regarding the future: the knowledge that ignorance is a condition for choices, and the knowledge that when ignorance doesn’t exist, there are no choices.
sn12.34:6.13: And the knowledge that this knowledge of the stability of natural principles is liable to end, vanish, fade away, and cease.
sn12.34:6.14: These are called the seventy-seven grounds for knowledge.”
